g.text: AI-powered configuration for Logitech MX Creative Console
Enter your Gemini API key (or press Enter for Wispy Cloud):
AI suggests this button layout for your project:
Based on: TypeScript AI Agent Platform + Git + Docker + CI/CD
Press Y to accept, n to reject, or c to customize individual buttons
You can always change this later in wispy.console.yaml
Press = Cycle between: Token budget | Response length | Creativity
AI Agent Prompt (send text to connected agent)
IDE Shortcut (trigger VS Code / Cursor action)
(commit, push, PR, build, test, deploy, marathon, voice)
(browse, click, extract, screenshot, form fill, automate)
(edit, search, explain, commit, bash, glob, refactor)
(the layout we just suggested, from step 3)
Connected (BT) -- scroll = AI depth, press = cycle mode
Enabled -- Dictate button routes to Gemini STT
LCD buttons are lighting up now...
Your MX Creative Console is ready.
Run "wispy console" to start | "wispy console edit" to modify layout
# ... 7 more buttons, page 2, dial config, ring config
FROM npx wispy-ai console setup TO LCD BUTTONS LIT UP
AI DOES THE HEAVY LIFTING // ONE COMMAND // ~30 SECONDS // FULLY CUSTOMIZABLE AFTER

text.tspan: STEP 1 -- validates API key, checks quota
STEP 2 -- Gemini reads package.json, git log, Dockerfile, CI config to understand your project
STEP 3 -- Gemini generates optimal button+dial layout based on project profile
STEP 4+5 -- per-button customization or one-click preset
STEP 6 -- writes wispy.console.yaml, connects hardware via Actions SDK, renders LCD icons, activates AI context engine

svg.text: DWG-008 // WIZARD CLI SETUP // SHEET 8 OF 8
WISPY CONSOLE // AI-POWERED DEVELOPER CONTROL SURFACE // LOGITECH ACTIONS SDK // HAUSOR LABS 2026
